content.description: A company trains its employees with instructional videos and claims that the amount of time, in hours, spent training is linearly related to an increase in productivity. The company selected a random sample of five employees to test its claim. The data were used to create the computer output for a least-squares linear regression, shown in the table.
content.question: Variable <math alttext="degrees of freedom" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DF</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Estimate <math alttext="standard error" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>SE</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Intercept 1 3.6 1.1489 Hours 1 0.8 0.3464 Which of the following is the correct test statistic and number of degrees of freedom?

choices.label: <math alttext="t equals 2.31" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.31</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with 4 degrees of freedom
<math alttext="t equals 2.31" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.31</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with 3 degrees of freedom
<math alttext="t equals 2.31" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.31</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with 5 degrees of freedom
<math alttext="t equals 3.13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.13</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with 1 degree of freedom
<math alttext="t equals 3.13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3.13</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with 3 degrees of freedom

content.answer: <math alttext="t equals 2.31" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.31</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with 3 degrees of freedom

topic.text: 9.5: Carrying Out a Test for the Slope of a Regression Model

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
